title: Authors and Citation
text: BOUSIGE C (2022). tutor: Interactive tutorials learning R. R package version 0.9, https://colinbousige.github.io/tutor/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tutor: Interactive tutorials for learning R},   author = {Colin BOUSIGE},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.9},   url = {https://colinbousige.github.io/tutor/}, }

title: Interactive tutorials for learning R
text: package gathering various interactive exercises “Reproducible data treatment R” class. also contains user-defined functions used class.

title: Interactive tutorials for learning R
text: First, install packages devtools, learnr gradethis don’t yet: run following install tutor package: also recommended install following package, use heavily exercises:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("rstudio/learnr", force = TRUE) devtools::install_github("rstudio/gradethis", force = TRUE) devtools::install_github("colinbousige/tutor") install.packages("tidyverse")

title: Interactive tutorials for learning R
text: installed package, launch tutorial running: call, "tutorial_name" can : "variables" "vectors" "dataframes" "plots" "fits"
code: library(tutor) tuto() # prints the list of available tutorials tuto("tutorial_name")

title: Interactive tutorials for learning R
text: tutor package also come bundled example files. complete list can accessed :
code: tutor_example() tutor_example(pattern = "csv") # apply a regex filter # To read a file, for example: read.csv(tutor_example("CO2_emission.csv"))

title: Sum of Gaussian functions — Gaussian
text: x x values x0 Center values (scalar vector) FWHM Full width half maximum (scalar vector length(x0)) Amplitudes (scalar vector length(x0), defaults '1') y0 baseline (scalar, defaults '0')

title: Sum of Gaussian functions — Gaussian
code: x <- seq(-10, 10, .1) y <- Gaussian(x, x0 = c(-2, 3), FW = c(1, 5), y0 = 1) plot(x, y, type = "l")

title: Sum of Lorentzian functions — Lorentzian
text: x x values x0 Center values (scalar vector) FWHM Full width half maximum (scalar vector length(x0)) Amplitudes (scalar vector length(x0), defaults '1') y0 baseline (scalar, defaults '0')

title: Sum of Lorentzian functions — Lorentzian
code: x <- seq(-10, 10, .1) y <- Lorentzian(x, x0 = c(-2, 3), FW = c(1, 5), y0 = 1) plot(x, y, type = "l")

title: Pressure <-> Ruby Raman shift — Pruby
code: Pruby(w, laser = 532, P = -1, w0 = -1, l = FALSE)

title: Pressure <-> Ruby Raman shift — Pruby
text: w Position R2 ruby line cm-1 laser laser wavelength nm (default=532) P Pressure GPa (default=-1). P>0, return expected position R2 line cm-1 w0 Position R2 ruby line cm-1 P=0 (default=-1). w0>0, corrects potential strain ruby. Otherwise, uses references lambda0 = 694.24 nm l TRUE FALSE (default). TRUE P>0, returns expected position R2 line nm instead cm-1.

title: Pressure <-> Ruby Raman shift — Pruby
code: Pruby(P = 1) # returns expected R2 position in cm-1 #> [1] 4400.406 Pruby(w = 4401) # return corresponding pressure in GPa #> [1] 1.077842

title: Raman Shift -> Wavelength — Rshift_to_lambda
text: w Raman Shift cm-1 laser laser wavelength nm

what: Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
title: Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
text: x x values y y values n order derivative

title: Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
Returns the nth derivative d^ny/dx^n — dxdy
code: x <- seq(-10, 10, .0001) y <- 1 + x + x^2 + x^3 + x^4 par(mfrow = c(2, 2), mar = c(4, 4, 1, 1)) plot(x, y, type = "l", main = "1+x+x^2+x^3+x^4") plot(dxdy(x, y, 1), col = "red", type = "l", main = "1+2x+3x^2+4x^3") plot(dxdy(x, y, 2), col = "blue", type = "l", main = "2+6x+12x^2") plot(dxdy(x, y, 3), col = "orange", type = "l", main = "6+24x")

title: Hello, World! — hello
code: hello() #> Error in hello(): could not find function "hello"

title: Simple numerical integration of y(x) — integ
Simple numerical integration of y(x) — integ
Simple numerical integration of y(x) — integ
text: x vector containing x values y vector containing y values

title: Simple numerical integration of y(x) — integ
